definition: ten thousand deaths will not prevent me (idiom); ready to risk life and limb to help out
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
see 万俟[Mo4 qi2]
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
(negative prefix)/not/no
old variant of 辭|辞[ci2]
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: Your self is sacrificed to the opinions and predilections of others.
sentences.chinese: 最终，你为了他人的偏好和评价而万死不辞。

sentences.english: I shall die again and again to know that life is inexhaustible.
sentences.chinese: 为了弄明白生是无穷无尽的，我将万死不辞。

definition: not to refuse to (idiom)/not to hesitate to
to offer one's life in sacrifice
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
until death puts an end (idiom); one's whole life/unto one's dying day
hard to forget even after one's teeth fall out (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
to serve (in some capacity)/to work for
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
lit. will not be forgotten even after one's teeth fall out/to remember as long as one lives/unforgettable (idiom)
to repay sb's kind acts (idiom)
not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
there is no harm in saying what one thinks (idiom)
lit. the kindness of recognizing sb's worth and employing him (idiom)/patronage/protection
your favor amounts to being given a new lease on life (idiom)
